title: If you continue to use instant 14 day bans for one word
body:
Then i'm sorry, but you need another banning tier.

Too many people are getting instant 2 week bans for as much as saying 1 bad word that is on an auto ban list, and if this keeps up, you need a 5th punishment tier.

Because let's face it, saying 1 bad word, should force a chat restriction, before it forces an instant 14 day ban.

solution is actually incredibly simple. blizzard does it right in their moba game. their punishment for consistent "bad chat behaviour" is that they mute a person for x amount of time.

it boggles my mind how complex riot and their helpers make it out to be.

>is that they mute a person for x amount of time.

Funny thing is, chat restrictions exist, but aren't used.

The logic baffles everyone tbh.

I can definitely agree with the sentiment here.

Suggestion:

1. 10 game chat restriction
2. 25 game chat restriction
3. 2-week ban
4. 3-month ban
5. Permanent ban

*Or*, for Leavebuster, punishments:
5 minute LPQ > 10 minute LPQ > 20 minute LPQ > 2-week ban > 3-month ban > Perma-ban

This introduces another layer into the severe punishment tiers, which will give players another (perhaps unneeded) chance to reform their behaviour (which, let's face it, is something a lot of players have been asking for), but it's not the kind of punishment that people could just "shrug off" like so many "troublesome" players do with the 2-week bans. It actually means the players will lose access to the account for a quarter of a year, and should be a very good indicator for everyone that a perma-ban is imminent.

I think there's a significant amount of players that understand the need for certain behaviours (such as suicide encouragement) to be taken more seriously because of their nature and the real-world implications they create, but at the same time it does seem like the system has gone into overdrive on the whole "political correctness" bullcr\*p. There needs to be some kind of tempering attitude to the whole thing, not *every* case needs to be escalated straight up the punishment tiers, for most people one hit will be enough to trigger a change (and I do believe that one of the tips in the loading screen will support that sentiment).

I don't know about 3 months, as that seems a little extreme (and would probably lead to people creating new accounts just to troll in that 3 months)
